content: 1 watchlings when the winter cold sets in and all the little animals start hibernating that s when the watchlings start their vigil they make sure everyone stays cosy in their burrow their food stores stay safe and the spring plants don t sprout too soon why not knit some to keep an eye on things for you this winter these cute little toys knit up quickly in just one piece and are a great way to use up your scrap yarn watchlings of course love all of the various winter festivities and love to dress in appropriately festive colours so they can join in the main thing is to play with your yarn and have fun and in no time you ll have a whole team of cosy little people to make you smile this pattern includes instructions for a toy knitted flat with two small seams to sew at the end and a version knitted in the round with one small seam to finish you will need to know how to knit purl increase and decrease © 2021 hazel wadeson for nuthanger knits 2 materials dk yarn all samples were made with scrap dk yarn with less than 30m 32 yards of yarn needed in total you need four colours per toy - lower body colour or trousers colour 6 5m 7 yards - sweater colour 9 5m 10 5 yards - flesh tone of your choice for face 3 5m 4 yards - hat colour 6 5 m 7 yards 3mm needles us size 2 5 these would be straight needles for the knitted flat version or needles for your circular knitting method of choice two circulars magic loop or double pointed needles can all be used yarn needle for sewing up and scissors pair of 5mm 1/4 inch safety eyes please note that safety eyes should not be used on toys that are intended for children below the age of 3 years and in that case you should embroider the eyes instead sewing over the purl stitch used to mark the eye position toy stuffing i used around 8g 0 3oz of polyester toy stuffing for each watchling you could also use wool batts or even leftover yarn ends that are too short for anything else sizing and pattern gauge when made in dk yarn each toy is approximately 11cm 4 ¼inches in height and 18cm 7 inches around the widest part of the body on 3mm needles with dk yarn the gauge for stockinette stitch was 6 sts per 2 5cm 1 inch matching gauge exactly is less important for this project than making sure you have a fabric that it is firm enough that the stuffing won t show through but not so tight that it becomes difficult to knit using a needle one to two sizes smaller than that recommended for the yarn is usual for knitted toys abbreviations k knit p purl sts stitches k2tog decrease by knitting 2 stitches together p2tog
